benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/block - Retrieve blocking states for account

covered: Valid Request: TC01 verifies successful retrieval (200) and schema validation for BlockingState objects.
Query Parameters: TC02-TC04, TC21 and TC22 exercise filtering by blockingStateTypes and blockingStateSvcs, including multi-value and combined filters.
Audit Levels: TC05-TC07 validate audit=FULL, audit=MINIMAL and default NONE behavior and the presence/absence of audit metadata per schema.
Empty Responses: TC08, TC09 and TC23 ensure the API returns an empty JSON array for accounts with no blocking states or non-existent accounts.
Input validation & error handling: TC10, TC11 and TC12 cover invalid accountId format and invalid query parameter values returning 400 with appropriate error messages.
Authentication: TC14 and TC15 cover missing and invalid authentication tokens returning 401.
Dependency & service errors: TC16 and TC25 cover service or dependency unavailability returning 503.
Performance & Scalability: TC17, TC19, TC24 and TC27 cover large-volume retrieval, timeout behavior/504, degraded performance scenarios, and concurrent request handling.
Security: TC18 addresses injection attacks in query parameters and verifies input validation/sanitization.
Backward compatibility & regression: TC20 and TC21 validate legacy-client behavior and regression around multi-filtering.
gaps: Pagination: No tests validate pagination behavior (page/limit/offset or server-side paging) or paging behavior for very large result sets.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests cover API rate limits or throttling behavior (e.g., returning 429 and Retry-After) under bursts of requests.
Caching / Conditional GET: No assertions for Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified headers or conditional GET handling (If-None-Match / 304 Not Modified).
Response headers / Content negotiation: Tests do not explicitly assert Content-Type (application/json) or Accept header handling.
Authorization edge-cases: No tests for authenticated-but-unauthorized scenarios (403 Forbidden) or role-based permission checks, if applicable.
Unsupported methods / 405: No tests ensuring other HTTP methods (POST/PUT/DELETE) are rejected with 405 Method Not Allowed.
Unexpected server errors (500): No explicit tests simulating unhandled exceptions to verify 500 error handling, message format and logging.
Boundary/fuzz input tests: Missing fuzz/boundary tests for extremely long query values, very large numbers of filter values, Unicode/multibyte characters beyond the injection case.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (if the API supports paging): verify page navigation, page sizes, boundary conditions and correct combination with filters and large datasets.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate request bursts to validate throttling behavior, expected 429 responses, and Retry-After header semantics.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: assert presence and correctness of Cache-Control and ETag (or Last-Modified) headers and test conditional requests returning 304.
Assert response headers and content negotiation: add checks that Content-Type is application/json, validate Accept header behavior and other relevant headers (Content-Length, Vary where applicable).
Include authorization edge-case tests: authenticated-but-unauthorized (403) scenarios and role/permission checks if RBAC applies.
Add unsupported-method tests: verify POST/PUT/DELETE (and others) return 405 with appropriate Allow header.
Include 500/internal error tests: simulate unexpected server exceptions to ensure graceful 500 responses, consistent error payloads and adequate logging/alerting.

Add boundary and fuzz tests: extremely long query parameter values, many repeated filter values, varied character sets (Unicode), and quantify performance SLAs (e.g., p95/p99 response time thresholds) and enforce them in TC17.
